item.title: Leetcode 1050: Actors and Directors Who Cooperated At Least Three Times
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECt actor_id, director_id FROM ActorDirector GROUP BY actor_id, director_id HAVING COUNT(timestamp) >= 3;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECt actor_id, director_id FROM ActorDirector GROUP BY actor_id, director_id HAVING COUNT(timestamp) >= 3;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1068: Product Sales Analysis I
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT a.product_name, b.year, b.price 
FROM Sales b
LEFT JOIN Product a
ON a.product_id = b.product_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT a.product_name, b.year, b.price FROM Sales b LEFT JOIN Product a ON a.product_id = b.product_id;

item.title: Leetcode 1075: Project Employees I
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT p.project_id, ROUND(AVG(e.experience_years), 2) AS average_years 
FROM Project p
LEFT JOIN Employee e
ON p.employee_id = e.employee_id
GROUP BY p.project_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT p.project_id, ROUND(AVG(e.experience_years), 2) AS average_years FROM Project p LEFT JOIN Employee e ON p.employee_id = e.employee_id GROUP BY p.project_id;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1084: Sales Analysis III
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT p.product_id, product_name 
FROM Product p 
LEFT JOIN Sales s
ON s.product_id = p.product_id
GROUP BY p.product_id
HAVING MIN(sale_date) >= CAST('2019-01-01' AS DATE) AND
       MAX(sale_date) <= CAST('2019-03-31' AS DATE);

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT p.product_id, product_name FROM Product p LEFT JOIN Sales s ON s.product_id = p.product_id GROUP BY p.product_id HAVING MIN(sale_date) >= CAST(‘2019-01-01’ AS DATE) AND MAX(sale_date) <= CAST(‘2019-03-31’ AS DATE);

item.title: Leetcode 1141: User Activity for the Past 30 Days I
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT activity_date AS day, COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS active_users
FROM Activity
WHERE activity_date > "2019-06-27" AND activity_date <= "2019-07-27"
GROUP BY activity_date;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT activity_date AS day, COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS active_users FROM Activity WHERE activity_date > “2019-06-27” AND activity_date <= “2019-07-27” GROUP BY activity_date;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1179: Reformat Department Table
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
select id, 
	sum(case when month = 'jan' then revenue else null end) as Jan_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'feb' then revenue else null end) as Feb_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'mar' then revenue else null end) as Mar_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'apr' then revenue else null end) as Apr_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'may' then revenue else null end) as May_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'jun' then revenue else null end) as Jun_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'jul' then revenue else null end) as Jul_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'aug' then revenue else null end) as Aug_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'sep' then revenue else null end) as Sep_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'oct' then revenue else null end) as Oct_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'nov' then revenue else null end) as Nov_Revenue,
	sum(case when month = 'dec' then revenue else null end) as Dec_Revenue
from department
group by id
order by id

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

select id, sum(case when month = ‘jan’ then revenue else null end) as Jan_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘feb’ then revenue else null end) as Feb_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘mar’ then revenue else null end) as Mar_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘apr’ then revenue else null end) as Apr_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘may’ then revenue else null end) as May_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘jun’ then revenue else null end) as Jun_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘jul’ then revenue else null end) as Jul_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘aug’ then revenue else null end) as Aug_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘sep’ then revenue else null end) as Sep_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘oct’ then revenue else null end) as Oct_Revenue, sum(case when month = ’nov’ then revenue else null end) as Nov_Revenue, sum(case when month = ‘dec’ then revenue else null end) as Dec_Revenue from department group by id order by id

item.title: Leetcode 1211: Queries Quality and Percentage
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT 
query_name, 
ROUND(SUM(rating/position)/COUNT(query_name), 2) as quality, 
ROUND(AVG(if (rating<3, 1, 0))*100, 2) as poor_query_percentage
FROM Queries
GROUP BY query_name
HAVING query_name is not null

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT query_name, ROUND(SUM(rating/position)/COUNT(query_name), 2) as quality, ROUND(AVG(if (rating<3, 1, 0))*100, 2) as poor_query_percentage FROM Queries GROUP BY query_name HAVING query_name is not null

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1251: Average Selling Price
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT p.product_id, IFNULL(ROUND(SUM(p.price * u.units) / SUM(u.units), 2), 0) AS average_price 
FROM Prices p
LEFT JOIN UnitsSold u
ON p.product_id = u.product_id AND p.start_date <= u.purchase_date AND u.purchase_date <= p.end_date
GROUP BY p.product_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT p.product_id, IFNULL(ROUND(SUM(p.price * u.units) / SUM(u.units), 2), 0) AS average_price FROM Prices p LEFT JOIN UnitsSold u ON p.product_id = u.product_id AND p.start_date <= u.purchase_date AND u.purchase_date <= p.end_date GROUP BY p.product_id;

item.title: Leetcode 1280: Students and Examinations
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT s.student_id, s.student_name, sub.subject_name, COUNT(e.student_id) AS attended_exams
FROM Students s
CROSS JOIN Subjects sub
LEFT JOIN Examinations e
ON s.student_id = e.student_id AND sub.subject_name = e.subject_name
GROUP BY s.student_id, s.student_name, sub.subject_name
ORDER BY s.student_id, sub.subject_name;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT s.student_id, s.student_name, sub.subject_name, COUNT(e.student_id) AS attended_exams FROM Students s CROSS JOIN Subjects sub LEFT JOIN Examinations e ON s.student_id = e.student_id AND sub.subject_name = e.subject_name GROUP BY s.student_id, s.student_name, sub.subject_name ORDER BY s.student_id, sub.subject_name;

item.title: Leetcode 1327: List the Products Ordered in a Period
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT p.product_name, SUM(o.unit) AS unit
FROM Products p
LEFT JOIN Orders o
ON p.product_id = o.product_id AND Left(o.order_date, 7) = '2020-02'
GROUP BY p.product_name
HAVING SUM(o.unit) >= 100;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT p.product_name, SUM(o.unit) AS unit FROM Products p LEFT JOIN Orders o ON p.product_id = o.product_id AND Left(o.order_date, 7) = ‘2020-02’ GROUP BY p.product_name HAVING SUM(o.unit) >= 100;

item.title: Leetcode 1378: Replace Employee ID With The Unique Identifier
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT u.unique_id, e.name
FROM Employees e
LEFT JOIN EmployeeUNI u
ON u.id = e.id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT u.unique_id, e.name FROM Employees e LEFT JOIN EmployeeUNI u ON u.id = e.id;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1407: Top Travellers
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT u.name, IFNULL(SUM(r.distance), 0) AS travelled_distance
FROM Users u
LEFT JOIN Rides r
ON u.id = r.user_id
GROUP BY u.id
ORDER BY travelled_distance DESC, name ASC;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT u.name, IFNULL(SUM(r.distance), 0) AS travelled_distance FROM Users u LEFT JOIN Rides r ON u.id = r.user_id GROUP BY u.id ORDER BY travelled_distance DESC, name ASC;

item.title: Leetcode 1517: Find Users With Valid E-Mails
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT *
FROM Users
WHERE REGEXP_LIKE(mail, '^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9\.\_\-]*@leetcode[.]com$');

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT * FROM Users WHERE REGEXP_LIKE(mail, ‘^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9._-]*@leetcode[.]com$’);

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1587: Bank Account Summary II
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT s.name, SUM(t.amount) balance
FROM Users s
LEFT JOIN Transactions t
ON s.account = t.account
GROUP BY s.account
HAVING balance > 10000;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT s.name, SUM(t.amount) balance FROM Users s LEFT JOIN Transactions t ON s.account = t.account GROUP BY s.account HAVING balance > 10000;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1633: Percentage of Users Attended a Contest
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT contest_id, IFNULL(ROUND(COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) * 100/(SELECT COUNT(user_id) FROM Users), 2), 0) percentage
FROM Register
GROUP BY contest_id
ORDER BY percentage DESC, contest_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT contest_id, IFNULL(ROUND(COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) * 100/(SELECT COUNT(user_id) FROM Users), 2), 0) percentage FROM Register GROUP BY contest_id ORDER BY percentage DESC, contest_id;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1661: Average Time of Process per Machine
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT a1.machine_id, ROUND(AVG(a1.timestamp - a2.timestamp), 3) processing_time
FROM Activity a1
JOIN Activity a2
ON a1.machine_id = a2.machine_id AND a1.activity_type = 'end' AND a2.activity_type = 'start'
GROUP BY machine_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT a1.machine_id, ROUND(AVG(a1.timestamp - a2.timestamp), 3) processing_time FROM Activity a1 JOIN Activity a2 ON a1.machine_id = a2.machine_id AND a1.activity_type = ’end’ AND a2.activity_type = ‘start’ GROUP BY machine_id;

item.title: Leetcode 1667: Fix Names in a Table
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT Users.user_id, CONCAT(UPPER(SUBSTR(Users.name, 1, 1)), LOWER(SUBSTR(Users.name, 2))) AS name FROM Users ORDER BY Users.user_id ASC;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT Users.user_id, CONCAT(UPPER(SUBSTR(Users.name, 1, 1)), LOWER(SUBSTR(Users.name, 2))) AS name FROM Users ORDER BY Users.user_id ASC;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1731: The Number of Employees Which Report to Each Employee
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT e1.employee_id, e1.name, COUNT(e2.reports_to) reports_count, ROUND(AVG(e2.age)) average_age
FROM Employees e1
INNER JOIN Employees e2
ON e2.reports_to = e1.employee_id
GROUP BY e1.employee_id
ORDER BY e1.employee_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT e1.employee_id, e1.name, COUNT(e2.reports_to) reports_count, ROUND(AVG(e2.age)) average_age FROM Employees e1 INNER JOIN Employees e2 ON e2.reports_to = e1.employee_id GROUP BY e1.employee_id ORDER BY e1.employee_id;

item.title: Leetcode 1741: Find Total Time Spent by Each Employee
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT
    event_day AS day,
    emp_id,
    SUM(out_time  - in_time) AS total_time
FROM Employees
GROUP BY day, emp_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT event_day AS day, emp_id, SUM(out_time - in_time) AS total_time FROM Employees GROUP BY day, emp_id;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1789: Primary Department for Each Employee
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT employee_id, department_id
FROM Employee
WHERE primary_flag = 'Y'
UNION
SELECT employee_id, department_id
FROM Employee
GROUP BY employee_id
HAVING COUNT(*) = 1

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT employee_id, department_id FROM Employee WHERE primary_flag = ‘Y’ UNION SELECT employee_id, department_id FROM Employee GROUP BY employee_id HAVING COUNT(*) = 1

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1795: Rearrange Products Table
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT product_id, 'store1' AS store, store1 AS price FROM Products
WHERE store1 IS NOT NULL
UNION
SELECT product_id, 'store2', store2 AS price FROM Products
WHERE store2 IS NOT NULL
UNION
SELECT product_id, 'store3', store3 AS price FROM Products
WHERE store3 IS NOT NULL;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT product_id, ‘store1’ AS store, store1 AS price FROM Products WHERE store1 IS NOT NULL UNION SELECT product_id, ‘store2’, store2 AS price FROM Products WHERE store2 IS NOT NULL UNION SELECT product_id, ‘store3’, store3 AS price FROM Products WHERE store3 IS NOT NULL;

item.title: Leetcode 184: Department Highest Salary
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT D.name AS Department, E.name AS Employee, E.salary
FROM
    Department D,
    Employee E
WHERE E.DepartmentId = D.id
    AND (DepartmentId, Salary) IN
    (SELECT DepartmentId, max(Salary) AS MAX FROM Employee GROUP BY DepartmentId);

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT D.name AS Department, E.name AS Employee, E.salary FROM Department D, Employee E WHERE E.DepartmentId = D.id AND (DepartmentId, Salary) IN (SELECT DepartmentId, max(Salary) AS MAX FROM Employee GROUP BY DepartmentId);

item.title: Leetcode 1873: Calculate Special Bonus
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT employee_id, salary * (employee_id % 2) * (name NOT LIKE 'M%') AS bonus FROM Employees ORDER BY employee_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT employee_id, salary * (employee_id % 2) * (name NOT LIKE ‘M%’) AS bonus FROM Employees ORDER BY employee_id;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 1965: Employees With Missing Information
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT T.employee_id
FROM
    (SELECT * FROM Employees LEFT JOIN Salaries USING(employee_id)
    UNION
     SELECT * FROM Employees RIGHT JOIN Salaries USING(employee_id))
AS T
WHERE T.salary IS NULL OR T.name IS NULL
ORDER BY employee_id;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT T.employee_id FROM (SELECT * FROM Employees LEFT JOIN Salaries USING(employee_id) UNION SELECT * FROM Employees RIGHT JOIN Salaries USING(employee_id)) AS T WHERE T.salary IS NULL OR T.name IS NULL ORDER BY employee_id;

item.title: Leetcode 197: Rising Temperature
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT w1.id
FROM Weather AS w1, Weather AS w2
WHERE w1.temperature > w2.temperature AND DATEDIFF(w1.recordDate, w2.recordDate) = 1;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT w1.id FROM Weather AS w1, Weather AS w2 WHERE w1.temperature > w2.temperature AND DATEDIFF(w1.recordDate, w2.recordDate) = 1;

Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 596: Classes More Than 5 Students
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT class
FROM
        (SELECT class, COUNT(DISTINCT student) AS num 
        FROM Courses
        GROUP BY class) AS TEMP
WHERE num >= 5;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

item.title: Leetcode 607: Sales Person
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
SELECT s.name
    FROM SalesPerson s
    WHERE s.name NOT IN(
    SELECT s.name
        FROM SalesPerson s
            LEFT JOIN Orders o ON s.sales_id=o.sales_id
            LEFT JOIN Company c ON c.com_id=o.com_id
        WHERE c.name='RED');

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT s.name FROM SalesPerson s WHERE s.name NOT IN( SELECT s.name FROM SalesPerson s LEFT JOIN Orders o ON s.sales_id=o.sales_id LEFT JOIN Company c ON c.com_id=o.com_id WHERE c.name=‘RED’);

item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

SELECT x, y, z,IF(x + y > z AND x + z > y AND y + z > x, ‘Yes’, ‘No’) AS triangle FROM Triangle;

item.title: Leetcode 619: Biggest Single Number
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

# Write your MySQL query statement below
select (
    select num 
    from MyNumbers 
    group by num 
    having count(*) = 1 
    order by num desc limit 1
) as num;

Write your MySQL query statement below Link to heading

select ( select num from MyNumbers group by num having count(*) = 1 order by num desc limit 1 ) as num;
